intro: Ternstroemia nabirensis, commonly known as the Nabire ternstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the lowland rainforests of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental shrubs. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found growing in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
